speaker: SPEED
text: Lance, by mine honesty, welcome to Padua.

speaker: LANCE
text: Forswear not thyself, sweet youth, for I am not

speaker: LANCE
text: welcome. I reckon this always: that a man is never

speaker: LANCE
text: undone till he be hanged, nor never welcome to a

speaker: LANCE
text: place till some certain shot be paid and the Hostess

speaker: LANCE
text: say welcome.

speaker: SPEED
text: Come on, you madcap. I’ll to the alehouse with

speaker: SPEED
text: you presently, where, for one shot of five pence,

speaker: SPEED
text: thou shalt have five thousand welcomes. But, sirrah,

speaker: SPEED
text: how did thy master part with Madam Julia?

speaker: LANCE
text: Marry, after they closed in earnest, they parted

speaker: LANCE
text: very fairly in jest.

speaker: SPEED
text: But shall she marry him?

speaker: LANCE
text: No.

speaker: SPEED
text: How then? Shall he marry her?

speaker: LANCE
text: No, neither.

speaker: SPEED
text: What, are they broken?

speaker: LANCE
text: No, they are both as whole as a fish.

speaker: SPEED
text: Why then, how stands the matter with them?

speaker: LANCE
text: Marry, thus: when it stands well with him, it

speaker: LANCE
text: stands well with her.

speaker: SPEED
text: What an ass art thou! I understand thee not.

speaker: LANCE
text: What a block art thou that thou canst not! My

speaker: LANCE
text: staff understands me.

speaker: SPEED
text: What thou sayst?

speaker: LANCE
text: Ay, and what I do too. Look thee, I’ll but lean,

speaker: LANCE
text: and my staff understands me.

speaker: SPEED
text: It stands under thee indeed.

speaker: LANCE
text: Why, “stand under” and “understand” is all

speaker: LANCE
text: one.

speaker: SPEED
text: But tell me true, will ’t be a match?

speaker: LANCE
text: Ask my dog. If he say “Ay,” it will; if he say

speaker: LANCE
text: “No,” it will; if he shake his tail and say nothing, it

speaker: LANCE
text: will.

speaker: SPEED
text: The conclusion is, then, that it will.

speaker: LANCE
text: Thou shalt never get such a secret from me but

speaker: LANCE
text: by a parable.

speaker: SPEED
text: ’Tis well that I get it so. But, Lance, how sayst

speaker: SPEED
text: thou that my master is become a notable lover?

speaker: LANCE
text: I never knew him otherwise.

speaker: SPEED
text: Than how?

speaker: LANCE
text: A notable lubber, as thou reportest him to be.

speaker: SPEED
text: Why, thou whoreson ass, thou mistak’st me.

speaker: LANCE
text: Why, fool, I meant not thee; I meant thy master.

speaker: SPEED
text: I tell thee, my master is become a hot lover.

speaker: LANCE
text: Why, I tell thee, I care not though he burn

speaker: LANCE
text: himself in love. If thou wilt, go with me to the

speaker: LANCE
text: alehouse; if not, thou art an Hebrew, a Jew, and not

speaker: LANCE
text: worth the name of a Christian.

speaker: SPEED
text: Why?

speaker: LANCE
text: Because thou hast not so much charity in thee

speaker: LANCE
text: as to go to the ale with a Christian. Wilt thou go?

speaker: SPEED
text: At thy service.
